author: glad
post_text: February 12, 2012 at 1:18 PM#1Creating a scroller_dimmer with the correct ranges for each frame, associating wheel-slots etc is a tedious job.This macro will create a 2 channel dimmer/scroller fixture with patchbreak, by entering fixture-name, total number of frames, names for each frame, and the defaultframe/open-position.please note:this macro needs to know its own ID (the macro number)please edit the first macro-line unless you import this Macro as Macro 1.e.g.SetUserVar $myID=15if you have import/moved the macro to Macro 15the created fixture will by default greate a generic range for the scroller attribute, e.g.Attribute "Scroller" At 5will set the scroller to the 5th frame, not to 5% of the scroll-length.If you prefer to work in percent (0-100) or decimal (0-255), please edit line 2 or 3e.g.SetUserVar $usepercent= "true"After the fixture is created, the GUI fixtureschedule is opened, to let you assign Colors to the slots via the colorpicker in the fixturetype-editor:Fixturetypes (U1) > Edit (X11) > Wheel Manager (U2) > EditRow (X11)Note 2.created/tested with version 2.5.3.uses generic@scroller_dimmer@00.xmlas templateLimitations:frame-names cannot contain spaces, or text that may be interpreted as a keyword or abbreviation of a keyword.if such names are used, the framename will be replaced by _frame_ and you will have to change the names afterwords.FilesScrollerWizard.xml15.07 kB – 155 Downloads
